title: OnOptions
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: These 2 kinds of employees are emerging in the AI-generated ‘workslop’ era—here’s why it may be better to write the email yourself
items.description: Forget “this could've been an email.” As AI automates more work, the new catchphrase at the office may be “this could've been written yourself.”

items.title: Why Entrepreneurs Earn More Than Salaried Employees
items.description: A recent study by the Minneapolis Fed found small business owners see faster rates of income growth than people collecting a paycheck.

items.title: Trump’s tariffs may be bringing in a lot of revenue but they’ve also been a ‘tax on capital, so far,’ top economist says
items.description: The "mystery" of the 2025 economy is vastly different from the record profit margins of 2021 and 2022, Morgan Stanley's Michael Gapen says.

items.title: Before the McLaren CEO got a $50 million payday from his team’s F1 championship, he was a high-school dropout who got his start on Wheel of Fortune
items.description: Zak Brown’s McLaren Racing Formula 1 team won its second consecutive Constructors’ Championship on Sunday.

items.title: Remote Employees Remain Highly Productive, a New Survey Says
items.description: While many employers now insist on people coming in, people working outside the office continue to perform well.
